Dear People,

Well...  I opine this is not Japanese at all and certainly not old.  It is a
recent copy made in China, as evidenced by the five claws and the style of the
dragon.  This is NOT IMHO a Japanese work.  Note also the crude asymmetry in
what purports to be a nakago ana!!!

Best regards,

Barry Thomas
(Melbourne, Australia)

----- Original Message -----
From: "sosidore" <sosidore@...>
To: <nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Tuesday, November 15, 2005 1:32 PM
Subject: [nihontostudy] A good story about one tsuba with some interesting
details missing


Dear all,

I have this interesting tsuba posted on Nihontostudy at:

All Albums  | Photo Albums > Sosidore > Iron Tsuba Dragon

Anyone well versed in Chinese artifacts knows this tsuba is an
unusual one. I would like to give some clue so that readers of this
message would came up with similar beliefe as I did.


Now, it is time that tsuba expert and historians take over
authentication processes from here.

Chen, Ying-chaw
Taipei
